sen.j: 源 常（みなもと の ときわ、弘仁3年（812年） - 斉衡元年6月13日 (旧暦)（854年7月15日））は平安時代前期の公卿。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Tokiwa (812 to July 15, 854) was a court noble in the early part of the Heian Period.
MINAMOTO no Tokiwa (812 to July 15, 854) was a court noble who live in the early part of the Heian Period.
sen.cmt: noble in the early part of the Heian Period → noble who live in the early part of the Heian Period
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Tokiwa (812 - July 15, 854) was a court noble who lived in the early part of the Heian Period.
sen.cmt: 生年表記の形式統一時制(live -> lived)

sen.j: 父は嵯峨天皇、母は飯高氏。
sen.e: His father was Emperor Saga, while his mother was of the Morotakauji.
His father was Emperor Saga, while his mother was of the Morotaka Clan.
His father was Emperor Saga, while his mother was of the Iitaka Clan.
sen.cmt: この母親は飯高宅刀自（いいたかのやかとじ）です。[http://www5b.biglobe.ne.jp/~yoropara/retuden/retu00243.htm]Morotaka Clan→Iitaka Clanとしました。

sen.j: 弘仁5年（814年）、源信 (公卿)・源弘とともに源朝臣姓を賜り、左京一条坊に貫付せられた。
sen.e: In 814, he was granted the asomi of "MINAMOTO" together with MINAMOTO no Makoto (court noble) and MINAMOTO no Hiromu and ordered to live at Ichijobo in Sakyo.
In 814, he was granted the title of Asomi of the MINAMOTO, together with MINAMOTO no Makoto (a court noble) and MINAMOTO no Hiromu, and was ordered to live at Ichijobo in Sakyo.
In 814, he was granted the title of Asomi of the MINAMOTO, together with MINAMOTO no Makoto (a court noble) and MINAMOTO no Hiromu, and was registered at Sakyoichijobo.
sen.cmt: 左京一条坊→Sakyoichijobo「貫付」は戸籍登録のことだと考えて「registered at」としました。

sen.j: 父である天皇は、常の「操行深沈、風神静爽」なのを見て、特に寵愛したと言う。
sen.e: His father Emperor Saga particularly loved Tokiwa for his considerateness and fair demeanor.
His father Emperor Saga particularly loved Tokiwa for his considerateness and fair demeanor.
His father Emperor Saga particularly loved Tokiwa for his composure and fair demeanor.
sen.cmt: considerateness（思いやり）→composure（落ち着き）としました。

sen.j: 天長5年（828年)17歳で従四位下、兵部卿に直叙され同八年従三位、翌年参議を経ずに中納言に昇進した。
sen.e: In 828, he was promoted to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank Low) and assigned to Hyobukyo (Minister of War) at the age of 17, and in 831 he was promoted to Chunagon without experiencing sangi (councillor).

In 828, he was promoted to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and assigned to Hyobukyo (Minister of War) at the age of 17, and in 831 he was promoted to Chunagon without first becoming Sangi (councillor).
sen.cmt: edited to match terms column, changed “experiencing” to “becoming”
sen.e: In 828, he was promoted to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and assigned to Hyobukyo (Minister of War) at the age of 17, and in 831 was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), and then in 832 was promoted to Chunagon without first becoming Sangi (councillor).
sen.cmt: 「従三位、翌年～」が抜けていました。

sen.e: He was only 21 years old at that time.
He was only 21 years old at that time.
He was only 21 years old at that time.

sen.j: その後、正三位で左近衛大将を兼ね、承和 (日本)5年（838年)に大納言、同七年に右大臣・東宮傅、十一年には左大臣と順調に昇っていった。
sen.e: Later, he served as Sakonoe no taisho (Western Commander) at the court rank of Shosammi (Senior Third Rank) and was promoted to Dainagon in 838, Udaijin (Minister of the Right) and Togu-fu in 840, and Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) in 842.

Later, he served as Sakonoe no taisho (Western Commander) at the court rank of Shosammi (Senior Third Rank) and was promoted to Dainagon in 838, Udaijin (Minister of the Right) and Togu-fu in 840, and Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) in 842.

Later, he served as Sakonoe no daisho (Major Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) at the court rank of Shosammi (Senior Third Rank) and was promoted to Dainagon (chief councilor) in 838, Udaijin (Minister of the Right) and Togu no fu (official in charge of education of the Crown Prince) in 840, and Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) in 842.

sen.j: その後10年にあまりにわたって政治の首班にあり兄弟の源信 (公卿)・源定・源弘とともに一大政治勢力をなした。
sen.e: He stayed at the top of the government for the ensuing 10 years or so to form a major political group together with his brothers MINAMOTO no Makoto (court noble), MINAMOTO no Sadamu, and MINAMOTO no Hiromu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He stayed at the top of the government for the ensuing 10 years or so to form a major political group together with his brothers MINAMOTO no Makoto (a court noble), MINAMOTO no Sadamu, and MINAMOTO no Hiromu.

He stayed at the top of the government for the ensuing 10 years or so to form a major political group together with his brothers MINAMOTO no Makoto (a court noble), MINAMOTO no Sadamu, and MINAMOTO no Hiromu.

sen.j: 嘉祥3年（850年）に正二位となる。
sen.e: In 850, he was promoted to Shonii.
In 850, he was promoted to Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
In 850, he was promoted to Shonii (Senior Second Rank).

sen.j: 常は「容儀閑雅、言論和順」であり、人材を見抜くのに優れ才能の士を推引し、讒侫の徒を遠ざけ、「丞相の器」と評された。
sen.e: Known for his "elegant and sedate behavior and soft-spokeness," his ability to judge people, his willingness to promote people of excellent capability, and his alienation of apple-polishers, Tokiwa was reputed to have what it takes to be the Regent.

Known for his "elegant and sedate behavior and soft-spokenness," his ability to judge people, his willingness to promote people of excellent capability and avoid yes-men, Tokiwa was reputed to have what it takes to be the Regent.

Known for his "elegant and sedate behavior and soft-spokenness," his ability to judge people, his willingness to promote people of excellent capability and avoid yes-men, Tokiwa was reputed to have what it takes to be the Regent.

sen.j: 承和7年（841年）には藤原緒嗣らと『日本後紀』を完成させている。
sen.e: In 841, he completed Nihon Kouki, (one of the Rikkoku-shi, the authentic chronicles of Japan compiled by the central government between the 8th and the 9th centuries), together with FUJIWARA no Otsugu.

In 841, he completed Nihon Kouki (one of the Rikkoku-shi, the authentic chronicles of Japan compiled by the central government between the 8th and the 9th centuries), together with FUJIWARA no Otsugu.
